statements.statement: In 2012 the top story followed was the Presidential election.
Three of the last two years' top 10 followed stories involved school shootings.
In both 2011 and 2012 almost half of the population followed shooting stories very closely.
An increasing percentage of people followed stories involving major mass shootings very closely.
The Japan disaster, in 2011, is the most followed story at fifty-five percent.
There were twice as many shooting related stories in the top followed stories charts in 2012 as there were in 2011.
Though the shootings recieved major public attention none of them were the most followed stories in the years that they occured.
mass shootings have been in the top 5 stories people followed in 2011 and 2012
Trends show that school shootings draw more interest then other events.
In 2011 people ranked stories about shootings as the 5th most important story, however in 2012 stories about shooting were ranked as the 2nd and 5th most top stories for the year.
In 2011, the trend was toward international news and in 2012 news was concentrated more on national events.
It's interesting that aside from the Presidential election, what grabs most interests is disasters that affect lots of people, whether local or not.
For 2011 and 2012, shootings were among the top followed stories of the year.
In 2012 the top 5 stories people followed closely centered on domestic issues such as the Presidential election, while in 2011 the top 5 stories involved more national affairs.
The top news story that people followed closely in 2011 was the Japan disaster, while in 2012 it was the presidential election.
In the past couple years mass shootings have made the list of the top five news stories.
The single most important trend is that a third of the most important stories for the past 2 years have to do with mass shootings.
New stories of mass shootings in the years 2011 and 2012 were followed closely by at least 48% of the American population.
Within the last two years, there have been three shootings of which at least 48% of Americans followed the stories "very closely."
The Presidential Election was the most highly watched story in 2012.

nuggets.nugget: In 2011, the Arizona shooting was the fifth most followed news story.
In 2012, two of the top 5 news stories were domestic shootings.
In the past two years, 3 of the most followed news stories were domestic shootings.
In each of the past two years, the rising price of gas/oil was one of the top 5 most followed news stories.
In 2012, the most followed news story was the presidential election.
In 2011, the most followed news story was the Japan disaster.
In the past two years, 2 of the most followed news stories were related to natural disasters.
In the past two years, many of the most followed news stories seemed to have a negative connotation.
In the past two years, at least half of the population followed shooting stories closely.
While shootings were among the top 5 stories in the past two years, they were never the top followed story.
